option.name: updatedContent
option.value:
# How to Manually Reimport Maven Project in IntelliJ IDEA
## Your project has been fixed! Here's what was done:
1. ✅ Restored deleted `.idea/workspace.xml` file 2. ✅ Created Maven wrapper files (`.mvn/wrapper/`) 3. ✅ Successfully rebuilt the project with Maven 4. ✅ Created module files (`.iml` and `modules.xml`) 5. ✅ All dependencies downloaded to local Maven repository
## To reload Maven dependencies in IntelliJ IDEA:
### Method 1: Maven Tool Window (Recommended) 1. Open IntelliJ IDEA with your project 2. Look for the **Maven** tool window on the right side 3. If you don't see it, go to `View` → `Tool Windows` → `Maven` 4. In the Maven tool window, click the **Reload All Maven Projects** button (circular arrows icon ) 5. Wait for the reload to complete
### Method 2: Right-click on pom.xml 1. In the Project view, right-click on `pom.xml` 2. Select `Maven` → `Reload project`
### Method 3: From Settings 1. Go to `File` → `Settings` (or `Ctrl+Alt+S`) 2. Navigate to `Build, Execution, Deployment` → `Build Tools` → `Maven` 3. Click `Reimport` or verify your settings 4. Click `OK`
### Method 4: Invalidate Caches (Nuclear option) 1. Go to `File` → `Invalidate Caches...` 2. Check **Invalidate and Restart** 3. Wait for IntelliJ to restart and reindex
## Verify External Libraries: After reimporting, check the **External Libraries** section in your Project view: - You should see JavaFX libraries (javafx-controls, javafx-fxml, etc.) - You should see all Maven dependencies from your pom.xml
## To Run the Project: 1. Set JAVA_HOME environment variable to: `C:\Program Files\Java\jdk-24` 2. Run the Main class from IntelliJ, or 3. Use Maven command: `mvnw.cmd clean javafx:run`
## Git Status: - ✅ Workspace files restored - ⚠️ Remember to commit the `.mvn/wrapper/` directory - ✅ `.gitignore` has been created to prevent tracking of `.idea/` in the future
